## Description {#details}

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/abstractcallsite">AbstractCallSite</a>.

An abstract call site is a wrapper that allows to treat direct, indirect, and callback calls the same. If an abstract call site represents a direct or indirect call site it behaves like a stripped down version of a normal call site object. The abstract call site can also represent a callback call, thus the fact that the initially called function (=broker) may invoke a third one (=callback callee). In this case, the abstract call site hides the middle man, hence the broker function. The result is a representation of the callback call, inside the broker, but in the context of the original call to the broker.

There are up to three functions involved when we talk about callback call sites. The caller (1), which invokes the broker function. The broker function (2), that will invoke the callee zero or more times. And finally the callee (3), which is the target of the callback call.

The abstract call site will handle the mapping from parameters to arguments depending on the semantic of the broker function. However, it is important to note that the mapping is often partial. Thus, some arguments of the call/invoke instruction are mapped to parameters of the callee while others are not.

Definition at line 50 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/abstractcallsite-h">AbstractCallSite.h</a>.

<SectionDefinition>

## Public Constructors

### AbstractCallSite() {#a582d0050c740c1f23bce6bc0c8c5b189}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>AbstractCallSite::AbstractCallSite (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a> &#42; U)</>}>
Sole constructor for abstract call sites (ACS).

Create an abstract call site from a use.

An abstract call site can only be constructed through a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">llvm::Use</a> because each operand (=use) of an instruction could potentially be a different abstract call site. Furthermore, even if the value of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">llvm::Use</a> is the same, and the user is as well, the abstract call sites might not be.

If a use is not associated with an abstract call site the constructed ACS will evaluate to false if converted to a boolean.

If the use is the callee use of a call or invoke instruction, the constructed abstract call site will behave as a llvm::CallSite would.

If the use is not a callee use of a call or invoke instruction, the callback metadata is used to determine the argument &lt;-&gt; parameter mapping as well as the callee of the abstract call site.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/abstractcallsite-h/#l00098">98</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/abstractcallsite-h">AbstractCallSite.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/abstractcallsite-cpp/#l00055">55</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/abstractcallsite-cpp">AbstractCallSite.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

## Public Static Functions

### getCallbackUses() {#a401e244b78386047c64edc64f80ba9c0}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void AbstractCallSite::getCallbackUses (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase">CallBase</a> &amp; CB, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a> &#42; &gt; &amp; CallbackUses)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Add operand uses of <code>CB</code> that represent callback uses into <code>CallbackUses</code>.

All uses added to <code>CallbackUses</code> can be used to create abstract call sites for which <a href="#a2300cb53451591b87c7c5621c31643a2">AbstractCallSite::isCallbackCall()</a> will return true.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/abstractcallsite-h/#l00105">105</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/abstractcallsite-h">AbstractCallSite.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/abstractcallsite-cpp/#l00034">34</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/abstractcallsite-cpp">AbstractCallSite.cpp</a>.
